title: Font for H&M
content:
Does anybody know what this font is???

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043350im_/http:/typophile.com/files/730px-H&M_logo_4276.svg.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [730px-H&M\_logo.svg\_.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043350/http:/typophile.com/files/730px-H&M_logo.svg_.png) | 36.15 KB |
author: d

comments.content:
That is almost certainly a custom logo and not a font. Off hand, I don't know of anything similar.

- Lex

I believe that [Stefan Hattenbach](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043350/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Stefan%20Hattenbach) created that specifically for H&M and it's proprietary to the company.

You might dig [FF DuMifu](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043350/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_dumifu/) or [FF DuDuchamp](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043350/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_duduchamp/?sample_size=96).

I've always liked that H & M logo. It is somewhere between a fairly restrained script and a traditional sign painters casual. A few others you might like which are closer to the latter category:

[Eckhardt Speedletter](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043350/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/eckhardt-speedletter/)  
 [Cedar Key Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043350/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/cedar-key/italic/)  
 [Dom Casual Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043350/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/dom-casual-sh/bold-italic/)  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/challenge-bold/plain/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043350/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/challenge-bold/plain/)Challenge Bold]]  
 [http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=23](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043350/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=23)|House Industries Sign Painter Collection]]

What is the second image you posted? Is that the Ikea showcard font? If so that is something else I've always admired. I think it is a custom font of theirs.

thank you!

the second image is of the H&M font
